definitions.body: owner, lord (Ph. [[בעל]]; Palm. id. husband Vog:62 cf. Bae:Rel 72 ff.; As. bêlu:1. c. Dl:Gram. Gloss.; Ar. ba9lun husband etc., v. esp. Nö:ZMG 1886, 174, Sab. [[בעל]] CIS:iv. 1, 2)—Ge 20:3 + 92 t.; sf. [[בַּעְלִּי]] Ho 2:18; [[בַּעְלָּהּ]] De 24:4 + 5 t.; pl. [[בְּעָלִים]] Ju Jdg 2:11 + 17 t.; cstr. [[בַּעֲלֵי]] Ge 14:13 + 27 t.; sf. [[בְּעָלָיו]] Ex 21:29 + 14 t.; [[בְּעָלֶיהָ]] Job 31:39 + 2 t.; [[בַּעְלֵּיהֶן]] Es 1:17, Es 1:20; —I.

owner (oft. pl. c. sf. in sg. mng.): of ox Ex 21:28, Ex 21:29, Ex 21:29, Ex 22:10, Ex 22:11, Ex 22:13, Ex 22:14 (E); [[הבור]] ´[[ב]] of pit Ex 21:34; Ex 21:36 (E), of house Ex 22:7 (E) Ju Jdg 19:22, Jdg 19:23, debt De 15:2, the land Job 31:39, the ass Is 1:3, goods Ec 5:10, riches Ec 5:12; [[טוב]] ´[[ב]] one to whom good is due Pr 3:27, gain Pr 1:19; [[שׂכל]] ´[[ב]] one having understanding Pr 16:22; [[השׁחד]] ´[[ב]] receiver of the gift Pr 17:8.

husband Ge 20:3, Ex 21:3, Ex 21:22 (E) De 22:22, De 24:4, 2Sa 11:26, Joe 1:8, Pr 12:4, Pr 31:11, Pr 31:23, Pr 31:28, Es 1:17, Es 1:20; [[בַּעְלִּי]] Ho 2:18 (my Baal, reference to the divine name used in the northern kingdom, here for the first time forbidden).

citizens, inhabitants: [[בַּעֲלֵי]] of Jericho Jos 24:11 (E), of the high places of Arnon Nu 21:28 (E), of Shechem Ju Jdg 9:2 + 12 t., of the tower of Shechem Ju Jdg 9:46; Jdg 9:47, of the city Ju Jdg 9:51, of Gibeah Ju Jdg 20:5, of Keilah 1Sa 23:11, 1Sa 23:12, of Jabesh 2Sa 21:12.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: [[בַּעֲלֵי]]:[[בְּדִית ]] ´[[בּ]] confederates Ge 14:13; [[חחים]] ´[[ב]] archers Ge 49:23 (poet.); [[הפרשׁים]] ´[[ב]] horsemen 2Sa 1:6; [[שׁבועה]] ´[[ב]] conspirators Ne 6:18; [[אספות]] ´[[ב]] members of assemblies; or well-grouped sayings; or collectors (of wise sentences) Ec 12:11.—On 2Sa 6:2 v. II. [[בַּעֲלָה]]. ([[בַּעַל]] in Hex not J or P; [[בעל]] Le 21:4 LXX e)za/pina = [[כבלּע]] Nu 4:20: Di [[בְּאֵבֶל]]). Esp. II. lord, specif. as divine name, † Baal.

without article: [[במות בעל]] Nu 22:41 (poet. Balaam); [[בעל פעור]] Nu 25:3, Nu 25:5 (E) De 4:3 (vid. below). This divine name is not used elsewhere in Hex. It probably originated from the sense of divine ownership, rather than sovereignty (RS:Sem 92). It seems to have been used in Northern Israel = [[אדון]] in the South. It was the special name of the God of the Canaanites, Philistines, etc., = Babylonian [[בֵּל]], cf. Schr:SK 1874, 335 ff. In later times scribes substituted [[בּשֶׁת]], in n.pr. ([[ירבשׁת]] = [[ירבעל]], [[אשׁבשׁת]] = [[אשׁבעל]], vid. [[בּשֶׁת]], Gei:ZMG 1862, 728 ff.), & also in the text for [[בעל]] Ho 9:10, Je 11:13 (hence h( ba/al Je 2:23, Je 7:9, Je 11:13, Je 11:17, Je 19:5, Ho 2:10, Ho 13:1 +, Ro 11:4, see Di:Baal mit d. weib. Art1 Kel, MBA 1881, June 16 Dr 2Sa 4:4).

[[הַבְּעָלִים]] emphatic pl. (cf. [[האלהים]], [[האדונים]]) the great lord, the sovereign owner Ju Jdg 2:11, Jdg 3:7, Jdg 8:33, Jdg 10:6, Jdg 10:10, 1Sa 7:4, 1Sa 12:10, 1Ki 18:18, 2Ch 17:3, 2Ch 24:7, 2Ch 28:2, 2Ch 33:3, 2Ch 34:4, Je 2:23, Je 9:13, Ho 2:15, Ho 2:19, Ho 11:2 (or local special Baïals, vid. Dr:Sm. p. 50; pillars of Baal MV).

c. attrib.: [[בַּעַל בְּרִית]] Lord of convenant Ju Jdg 8:33, Jdg 9:4 (cf. [[אל ברית]] Jdg 9:46; Nö:ZMG 1888, 478); [[זְבוּב]] ´[[ב]] Lord of flies 2Ki 1:2, 2Ki 1:3, 2Ki 1:6, 2Ki 1:16, Philistine god, LXX Baal mui=an (Beelzebub, Mt 12:24) cf. Bae:Rel 25.
